intro: Geissaspis drepanocephala, commonly known as the narrow-headed geissaspis, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a compact growth form and distinctive, narrow leaves. The plant exhibits a complex root system adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, often found in shaded, moist forest understories. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying a range of colors from white to pale yellow. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
